quote: Veni, vidi, made Some Spring Stuff

content.text: After attempting to learn basics of web-development myself I felt a need to make a helpful studying tutorial by myself. All the sources that I have used to learn Spring Framework (Java-based backend development framewoork) seemed difficult to use.

Some were too confoluted. It took countless hours to grasp the basic understanding of a topic through numerous text and video sources. Others were teaching things that I never came to use - the pieces of knowledge that they were conveing to readers were deattached from the real world. They lacked any visible application.

Some Spring Stuff was my attempt to create a guide for people that want to get into web development. The idea was that it would focus on the people that have only understood the basics of Java language.
I wanted to create a site that would outline a process of creating a simple Spring project. I would use that to then explain the topics that are used in creating real-world applications.
I also thought that as I was a begginer in web development my explanations of the concepts would be more intuitively understandable.

paragraphs.heading: What part of the project I completed

content.text: I wrote all of the text for the website. I have spent over 3 months researching and trying to understand the most basic and essential components of the technology. Then I attempted to put every piece of knowledge I gained into a comprehensive guide.

After that I began creating a website. I had no understanding how to make one, so I spent 2-3 months attempting my best to make a website using plain HTML and CSS. Was one of the most misserable experiences of my life. Please don't do it. Use more adavnced options.

paragraphs.heading: Interesting things I learned doing project

content.text: For this project I tried something totally new for me: I tried to teach others how to do things. I am thankful to Some Spring Stuff for a number of reasons. Firstly, it taught me a lot about Sprinng Framework. Many aspects of that technology seemed too obscure when I was making my own code. But after searching for things to make the website a lot has clarified.

I also learned that I am not that great of a programming instructor yet. I decided to take a pause in that, get a degree first before teachinng others how to code. That is if I will want to teach. Or if I will want to get a degree, for that matter :-)
